column4: Hello. I am fairly new to Ubuntu. I plan on formatting my computer and setting it up to duel-boot with Ubunti 12.04 & Windows 7. With my current duel-boot setup, I cannot access the ubuntu-related partitions with Windows (however I can access Windows related partitions with Ubuntu). Is it possible / is a bad idea to have my /home folder on a NTSF format partition? Is there other options?
I think there were some ext3 drivers for windows. you might want to use them.
N4rc: Thanks. I'll take a look into that :)
I would use the ext drivers as it's the technical appropriate way to access your files.
